intro: Rhopaloblaste micrantha, commonly known as the small-flowered rhopaloblaste, is a species of flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many economically important plants such as coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and lance-shaped leaves. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments within tropical forests. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and somewhat obscure species within its family.
